metadata.title: Enantioselective syntheses of carbocyclic nucleosides 5 0 -homocarbovir, epi-4 0 -homocarbovir, and their cyclopropylamine analogs using facially selective Pd-mediated allylations

abstract.original_text: Carbocyclic nucleosides (À)-5 0 -homocarbovir and (þ)-epi-4 0 -homocarbovir were prepared from an acylnitroso-derived hetero DielseAlder cycloadduct. A kinetic enzymatic resolution generated an enantiopure aminocyclopentenol and Pd(0)-mediated decarboxylative allylations of allyl 2,2,2-trifluoroethyl malonates were used to install the 4 0 -hydroxyethyl groups. Late stage derivatization gave access to the cyclopropylamine analogs, (À)-5 0 -homoabacavir, and (þ)-epi-4 0 -homoabacavir. All carbonucleoside target molecules were evaluated for antiviral activity.

sentences.segment_text: Carbocyclic nucleosides ( À ) -5 0 - homocarbovir and ( þ ) - epi-4 0 - homocarbovir were prepared from an acylnitroso-derived hetero DielseAlder cycloadduct .

A kinetic enzymatic resolution generated an enantiopure aminocyclopentenol and Pd ( 0 ) - mediated decarboxylative allylations of allyl 2,2,2-trifluoroethyl malonates were used to install the 4 0 - hydroxyethyl groups .
Late stage derivatization gave access to the cyclopropylamine analogs ,
All carbonucleoside target molecules were evaluated for antiviral activity .
